name: Holiday Inn Kalamazoo-West

reviews.text: Friendly staff, great service. We were there as part of a baseball team for a tournament, and the staff was very accomodating - helping us set up an impromptu pizza party on the patio, for instance. We were able to book a block of rooms. The pool was great for the kids. Everything seemed really well taken care of and clean. The rooms were small - two double beds for a family of four. The bathroom was also smaller, but for the price we paid the value was great. Again, everything was clean. Elevators were prompt. There was a great restaurant that offered kids free meals with an adult meal purchase, we used it for the tasty breakfast buffet. Location is just off the freeway, so easy access.
reviews.title: Clean, Great Value

reviews.text: Room was nice and restaurant was great for dinner. The bar deals were even better! Pool area was very humid but bearable. Splash / bucket drop area of pool wasn't working. Biggest complaint was no mini fridge. Have become accustomed to most providing, it was a let-down to be missing. Like I said lots to do with indoor pool, pool tables, ping pong, arcade, and fitness center.
reviews.title: Nice, friendly hotel with several things to do

reviews.text: We recently stayed here for a couple of nights while our youngest son was attending his orientation sessions for Western Michigan University. We had a pleasant, comfortable stay there and will certainly stay there again when in the area. The restaurant on-site was good for breakfast and you can't beat the location when attending events @ WMU.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: One thing that could be improved on was the cleaning around the hot tub area around the pool. We used the hot tub on Monday evening, Tuesday evening and then again before we checked out on Wednesday morning. The same candy wrappers, small pieces of cloth and dirt from the planter near the hot tub were still there and weren't hard to miss.
reviews.title: Lots to do at hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in room 216 and the shower was slow to drain and after a couple of minutes the water was ankle deep. We left a note for the maid about this and it must have been addressed as the next shower taken was better, but still a little water build up. the attention to this matter was appreciated.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: The Holiday Inn West is a little out of the way. There's nothing close by or within walking distance. If you don't have a car then there is a free shuttle bus that will take you places - just book it a little in advance. The rooms are clean and generally well equipped. The beds are large and comfortable (with silly little pillows as another reviewer already mentioned). The bathrooms are spacious with a hot and powerful shower. Nice linen and towels.
reviews.title: Generally a good place to stay while on business in Kzoo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But some things they could do better here
reviews.title: A Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) The rooms are hot! Really hot! And the air conditioning units are very very noisy.
reviews.title: First stop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) No opening windows (on either poolside or outside, so the rooms are very stuffy). Bring ear plugs if noise keeps you awake, poolside can be noisy for obvious reasons. Or just because of the griding of the air con unit
reviews.title: Dont eat at Old Burdicks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3) Proper coffee in the rooms is always nice to have, but please put milk (even UHT) rather than the non dairy creamer sachets. It would be nice (and better on the environment too) to have china rather than disposible polystyrene cups as well.
reviews.title: Nice for the price

reviews.text: Stayed with my husband two nights to attend a wedding. Even though two other wedding parties were also staying there the same weekend, we never encountered too much noise or felt crowded. In spite of the staff being kept quite busy, they always had a smile on their face and were always willing to accommodate you. They were great! I will give the staff a 5+.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.text: Our room was very clean and spacious, had a king bed, a sofa-bed, mini fridge, and microwave. The pillows were a little bit too thick for me, but perfect for my husband's taste.
reviews.title: Decent, just don't expect to use the gym

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't have an opinion on the pool and fitness center because we had a full schedule and didn't have time to use them.
reviews.title: Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was well stocked, with a good variety to satisfy different tastes. The omelets were very good. I do think that breakfast should be included at no extra fee.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet and reasonably priced

reviews.text: If I return to Kalamazoo, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel
reviews.title: ok hotel to stay

reviews.text: Stayed here when my normal hotel was booked up for my whole trip. Pretty nice place. Room by the pool was a little loud but manageable. The shuttle driver bret who picked me up from the airport was a riot. It was nice after a long flight. Kalamazoo is my home away from home so its nice to find quality places to stay.
reviews.title: Good Fall Back

reviews.text: Some colleagues and I go here every year in the springtime for a conference, and it's always a pleasure. The hotel is relatively simple but very good. The beds are very comfortable, though a feather pillow option would be good for those of us allergic to pillows that push back. The staff is wonderfully friendly and helpful -- perhaps the very best part of the hotel. There is an excellent indoor pool where one can swim as early as 6:30; a well-equipped fitness room rarely empty; a games room; and Old Burdick's is a comfortable and friendly restaurant in the bar-and-grill style. There is free WiFi that is pleasantly quick; and the whole is just off Highway 131 and only a short drive from the University and downtown. Why go anywhere else?
reviews.title: Every year, and always a pleasure

reviews.text: Overall the stay was good, the staff was nice and the restaurant was great but unfortunately the morning after I checked out out my legs started itching and when I got home to Houston and undressed I noticed about 10 little bites all over me, I'm pretty sure it is bed bugs so I called the hotel and spoke to Casey and all she did was apologize. Although I appreciate the apology I think they should have done more and for that reason alone I would rate this hotel poor and would not recommend.
reviews.title: Bed Bugs

reviews.text: i travel over 200 days per year, and i must say that this was a great hotel. The staff from check in, to the restaurant/bar staff were all very nice. Besides that, the rooms are very clean, nice and updated. The food at the restaurant was excellent & it was not your normal hotel bar and grill. I was there on business, but there were lots of familys and kids, but if you dont like that it was ok, just stay out of the pool area. With that said it seemed to be kid friendly as well, which i normally don't like as a business traveler, but it was fine. Great choice in Kalamazoo area, its not a Four Seasons, but for the area, a wonderful choice. Downside, fitness center could be larger, but everything else made up for it.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.text: Everything was clean and all of the staff was very friendly. They went out of their way to make sure your stay was a good one. Rooms were all maintained well and the lobby was well done. The food at the restraunt was excellent as well as their selection of draft beers.The fitness center is small with limited equipment, which is the only thing that kept me from giving five stars.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn West - Kalamazoo

description: Holiday Inn West, the best in personalized guest experiences. We’re here to serve you!
